summary: Completed testing of Excess Usage Tracking feature. Backend API /api/usage-logs/excess-usage and /api/reminders/check-pending-invoices working correctly. Frontend Usage Tracking page displays 'Customers Exceeding Usage Limits' section with test data. All 13 backend tests passed (100%). Frontend login, navigation, and excess usage display working correctly.

issues: ESLint warnings for missing dependencies in useEffect hooks (fetchExcessUsage, fetchUsageLogs) - not critical but should be addressed

critical_code_review_comments: UsageTracking.js has ESLint warnings for missing useEffect dependencies - consider using useCallback for fetch functions or adding eslint-disable comments

success_rate.frontend: 100% - Login, navigation, excess usage display all working

seed_data_creation: Test customer 'Test Excess Corp' (cust_7dac594a9f3c) with excess usage data for Jan 2026 - Orders: 1500 (limit 1000), Users: 2500 (limit 1000)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Excess Usage feature fully tested and working. Test customer 'Test Excess Corp' has usage logs for Jan 2026 that exceed limits. Backend endpoint /api/usage-logs/excess-usage returns correct data. Frontend displays the data correctly in the 'Customers Exceeding Usage Limits' section.

backend_endpoints.notes: Returns customers exceeding usage limits with correct structure
Returns customer list including test customer
Returns usage logs for specific customer

frontend_features.notes: Displays customers exceeding limits with correct data
Modal opens with all form elements

mocked_apis_note: Razorpay integration uses test keys, AWS SES email is stubbed
